channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Contained - Brush Fire; INC#0699; 10:44AM; 5010 N Griffin Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/38UqBcp; #MontecitoHeights; The first arriving LAFD Firefighters have driven/hiked to the remote location near the Walnut Forest Trail and Seco Valle Trail in Ernest Debs Regional Park to contain and extinguish small fire, that appeared to be an unattended makeshift fire pit. There were thankfully no wind, and the fire was prevented from extending into nearby brush. No injury. No structure threat. No evacuation.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO2 BC1 BC2 BP44 BP47 E1 E12 E16 E201 E250 E290 E44 E47 E55 EM1 H3 H4 H7 HA3 HA4 HA7 RA12 T1 T50 T90; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#0699; 10:24AM; 5010 N Griffin Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/38UqBcp; #Montecito Heights; PRELIM: LAFD ground response to a small fire among grass and heavy brush in remote terrain near the Walnut Forest Trail and Seco Valle Trail in Ernest Debs Regional Park. No wind. No structure threat. No evacuation.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AO2 BC1 BC2 BP44 BP47 E1 E12 E16 E201 E250 E290 E44 E47 E55 EM1 H3 H4 H7 HA3 HA4 HA7 T1 T50 T90; CH5; 12; Brian Humphrey

Update Fatality Structure Fire; INC#0468; 08:58AM; 8766 N Matilija Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45zlCrW; #PanoramaCity; There are now a total of *six* patients from this fire: The adult female civilian who is deceased at scene; and *five* other civilians (including one child), all in fair condition. Two patients are declining ambulance transport, and *three* others are being taken to area hospitals by LAFD Paramedics for treatment following exposure to smoke. The age, gender and affiliation of the patients, and their circumstances at the time of the fire have yet to be determined. The fire cause remains under active investigation.; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AP7 AR11 AR21 AR25 AR34 AR38 AR9 BC12 E289 E298 E37 E474 E98 EM10 RA75 RA77 RA87 RA89 RA98 RA989 SO1 T89 T98; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Fatality Structure Fire - Now Out 10/18/2023 INC#0468

item.description: Fatality Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0468; 08:08AM; 8766 N Matilija Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45zlCrW; #PanoramaCity; 34 LAFD Firefighters responded quickly to find fire showing from a 1,535 square foot one-story home. During an aggressive and well-coordinated fire attack, firefighters discovered an adult female - described by residents as mobility impaired, lifeless in a rear bedroom. Beyond medical help, she was determined dead and remains at the scene. The fire was extinguished in just 21 minutes (8:29 AM), and confined within the residence. Three other residents, including one child, who were home at the time of the fire, are now being medically evaluated by LAFD Paramedics at scene for smoke exposure. The presence and functional status of smoke alarms at the time of the fire has yet to be determined. The home, built in 1949, was not equipped with (optional) residential fire sprinklers. The fire cause is under active investigation.; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AP7 BC12 E289 E290 E298 E37 E474 E98 EM10 RA75 RA77 RA87 RA989 SO1 T89 T90 T98; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 10/18/2023 INC#0255

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0255; 05:43AM; 1547 N Sierra Bonita Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46Vd8fS; #Hollywood; 69 LAFD Firefighters took 65 minutes in largely defensive firefighting operations to extinguish fire in a vacant and under construction two-story home with basement that was fully involved on LAFD arrival. The flames were prevented from damaging structures on three sides of the burning building. No injuries have been reported. Fire Department and allied agency operations will continue on site well into the morning, as Fire Department heavy equipment (e.g. bulldozer, excavator) is brought in to lift and move the massive amount of still smoldering debris. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E41 E5 E61 E76 E82 E95 E97 EA1 EM14 HE1 HR3 RA27 RA41 RA803 RA827 SO1 SQ95 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire 10/18/2023 INC#0255

item.description: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0255; 05:10AM; 1547 N Sierra Bonita Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46Vd8fS; #Hollywood; 69 LAFD Firefighters continue defensive firefighting in what are expected to be extended operations at a vacant two-story home with basement, under construction, that was fully involved on LAFD arrival. The flames have been prevented from damaging and no longer threaten structures on three sides. No injuries reported.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E41 E5 E61 E76 E82 E95 E97 EM14 HR3 RA27 RA41 RA803 RA827 SO1 SQ95 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0255; 04:38AM; 1547 N Sierra Bonita Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46Vd8fS; #Hollywood; PRELIM: Defensive operations at fully involved vacant two-story home under construction, flames and heat threatening structures on three sides. ; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E41 E5 E61 E76 E82 E95 E97 EM14 HR3 RA27 RA41 RA803 RA827 SO1 SQ95 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0120; 02:03AM; 2346 N Cahuenga Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FmhUaj; #HollywoodHills; PRELIM: Solo vehicle left Hollywood (US 101) Freeway landing on or near surface streets, and was fully involved with fire on LAFD arrival. Three patients total (2 with serious to critical injuries / 1 with minor injuries) have been taken to area hospitals by LAFD Paramedics. Unconfirmed ages/genders/conditions/affiliation/circumstances). Media Inquiries: CHP Central L.A. (Log #175).; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; E235 E76 RA27 RA76 RA827 RA861 T35; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0092; 01:39AM; 4646 N Nagle Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Qmwuow; #ShermanOaks; 47 LAFD Firefighters took just 23 minutes (2:02 AM) to fully extinguish heavy fire involving a 1,409 square foot one-story home. No injuries reported. The cause of the fire is considered suspicious - and was among several rubbish/debris/vegetation fires discovered nearby at the same time. The other fires were quickly extinguished by LAFD responders, before they could cause structural damage or injury. LAFD and LAPD Investigators are actively investigating the fires, and have not yet issued a formal statement that tallies the fires, identifies suspect/s or connects these fires to the earlier suspicious fires in the 13800 block of Ventura Boulevard.; FS 102; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 BC14 E102 E108 E227 E239 E260 E39 E86 E89 RA102 RA88 SO1 T27 T39 T60; CH9; 18; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1905; 11:19PM; 13838 W Ventura Blvd; MAP: https://bit.ly/490sG3u; #ShermanOaks; 49 LAFD Firefighters took just 23 minutes (11:42 PM) to extinguish an outside fire that extended into and heavily involved a 3,000 square foot one-story floral shop within a block-long row of commercial structures. The well-coordinated firefight prevented fire damage to adjacent buildings. No injuries have been reported. The cause of the fire is considered suspicious - and was among a handful of rubbish/debris/vegetation fires that occurred in the general area at the time of the fire. The other fires were quickly extinguished by LAFD responders, before they could cause structural damage or injury. A team of LAFD Investigators is actively investigating the fires.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; AR1 BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E102 E108 E239 E278 E288 E88 E99 EM14 RA78 RA878 SO1 T39 T78 T88; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey
